snippet: Green River Community College, south of Seattle, has enrolled 1,400 international students this year, most of them recruited by agents who get 15 percent of the $9,732 first-year tuition.
abstract: Green River Community College near Seattle has enrolled 1,400 international students in 2012, most of them recruited by agents who get 15 percent of the $9,732 first-year tuition; such recruiting agents are illegal in the United States, and their use abroad remains a highly divisive and hotly debated issue in higher education circles.
lead_paragraph: Green River Community College, south of Seattle, has enrolled 1,400 international students this year, most of them recruited by agents who get 15 percent of the $9,732 first-year tuition.

headline.seo: Smaller Colleges Rely on Paid Student Recruiters Overseas
headline.main: Illegal in U.S., Paid Agents Overseas Help American Colleges Recruit Students
headline.print_headline: Illegal in U.S., Paid Agents Overseas Help American Colleges Recruit Students
